report_title: Leather Tanning & Finishing in the US
executive_summary: The Leather Tanning and Finishing industry has witnessed some distinct shifts in recent years, driven largely by socio-economic factors and evolving market dynamics. Once a booming sector closely associated with the country's economic prosperity and industrial advancement, the industry has lately grappled with numerous challenges, like decreased domestic production and a heightened influx of imported finished leather products. Environmental regulations, changing consumer preferences and competition from synthetic alternatives have also presented significant hurdles...

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Fashion Trends Impacting Leather Industry with Rise of Vegan Alternatives
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Fashion trends are impacting the leather tanning and finishing industry, with an increasing preference for vegan leather because of its cruelty-free nature, lower cost, and minimal environmental impact.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Leather's Timeless Appeal Remains Strong in Luxury Automotive and Furniture Industries
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The high-end automotive and furniture industries remain firm patrons. These sectors continue to use high-quality, robust leather materials for their premium product lines, underlining the timeless appeal and necessity of leather.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Environmental Regulations Increase Eco-Innovation in Leather Tanning Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Environmental regulations have been significantly reinforced, notably affecting industries identified as major pollutants - particularly the leather tanning and finishing industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Tanneries Will Need Significant Investment to Adopt Leather Recycling Strategies
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As part of the drive towards sustainability, recycling leather from clothing, automotive, or other high-quality waste sources will likely become more common in the Leather Tanning and Finishing industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Competition Will Intensify Domestically and Internationally
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The leather tanning and finishing industry will face stiffer competition at home and abroad.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Competition Will Intensify From Imports and Sustainable Alternatives
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Imports will pose a growing competitive threat to domestic leather production.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Regulatory Pressures Will Mount for Environmental Safety
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As environmental concerns intensify, regulations impacting the leather tanning and finishing industry will become more stringent.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry engage in activities like tanning, currying and finishing hides and skins.
key_trends: The Leather Tanning and Finishing industry is moderately competitive.
Businesses compete based on factors like location and price.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The apparel and footwear market is a comprehensive collection of jackets, coats, trousers and shoes.
The overall apparel manufacturing sector has experienced a sharp drop.

products_and_services.product_description: Chrome tanning prevails in the leather industry because of its efficiency.
Vegetable tanning removes moisture from an animal's epidermis using a tanning solution frequently made from trees and other plants.

tier_1_buyers: Leather Goods & Luggage Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The price of leather is highly correlated with the cost of animal hides.

business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic Region is Estimated to Account for the Largest Share of Establishments.
